summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 between FBI personnel and Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) in the Southern District of New York, coordinating the updating of a victim notification spreadsheet for the case 'US v. Epstein'. The emails discuss adding new victim names, correcting errors, and obtaining contact information.

persons.name: Moe
persons.context: Appears to be the primary point of contact maintaining and updating the victim notification spreadsheet for the SDNY AUSAs, receiving requests for corrections and additions.

events.title: Coordination of Victim Notification List Updates
events.description: A series of emails between SDNY AUSAs, FBI personnel, and a Victim-Witness Assistant discussing updates, corrections, and additions to the victim list for the Epstein case in the Victim Notification System (VNS).

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office â€” SDNY, 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The emails reveal an active effort in July 2019 by the SDNY and FBI to compile and verify a comprehensive list of victims for notification in the case 'US v. Epstein'.
The Victim Notification System (VNS) was being used to manage victim information, and there was a need to coordinate between the AUSAs and FBI to ensure accurate data entry and avoid duplication.
The correspondence indicates challenges in obtaining complete contact information for some identified victims, requiring coordination with case agents.
The volume of victims mentioned suggests a significant number of individuals were being considered for notification in the case.
